repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: Ulakanīti (literally "The right conduct in the world") by Ulakanātar (17th c. at the latest) is a didactic work containing aphorisms on good conduct in the form of don'ts. The present version consists in ten numbered sections of eight lines each.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (July 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Ulakanīti: Invocation. No foliation. Verso blank. Shelfmark on recto.
1 folio = Blessings. No foliation. Shelfmark and scribbles on verso.

supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation. A few worm-holes.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 76 (front cover, recto).
Shelfmark in black ink: N° 20 (f[1]r). This is the number in Velanguani Arokium's catalogue, first numbered list (f. 4r, no. 17 et 20).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: Dated to circa 1725 by Vinson (1868) and to 1725 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1845, since described in Velanguani Arokium's catalogue (1845). Not after 1833 as donated in that year by Reydellet.

provenance.p: Most probably a manuscript owned by Reydellet as indicated by the shelfmark in black ink N° 20 (U1, f[1]r), which most probably refers to the number in Velanguani Arokium's catalogue (1845), first numbered list (p. 7). See item 16 (Justice du monde) in Liste des manuscrits Tamouls donnés à la Bibliothèque du Roi par M. Reydelet (NAF 5441, f311v).

acquisition.p: Received, May 27th, 1833, from Reydellet (officier de marine en retraite au Havre). See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1, no. 39 (Justice du monde).

listBibl.bibl: Ulakanīti 1918. Ulakanīti uraiyum kataikkuṟippum. Edited by Vāḻkutai Veṅkaṭarāma Cāstrikaḷ. Ceṉṉai: Ār. Kaṇapati Aṇṭu Kampeṉi.
Ulakanīti n.d. In: Nītinūṟ kottu. Mūlamum uraiyum. Taṉalukkumi Puttakacālai Cuṉṉakam.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 15.

Sweetman, Will & R. Ilakkuvan. 2012. The Bibliotheca Malabarica: Bartholomäus Ziegenbalg’s Tamil Library: An Annotated edition and translation. Pondicherry: EFEO and IFP. (Indologie no. 119) ― See p. 111.
Velanguani Arokium [Vēḷāṅkaṇṇi Ārōkkiyam]. 1845. Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls de la Bibliothèque royale. BnF NAF 5443. — See f. 4r, no. 17 et 20.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49). — See p. 23.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
